definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: Attica is defined by avantgarde design and top-notch sound from a world-class system.
sentences.chinese: 爱奇多被评为设计前卫且音响设备顶尖的俱乐部。

sentences.english: Nancy:This theatre company is very avantgarde.
sentences.chinese: 这个戏剧团的演出非常前卫。

sentences.english: With smart power, diplomacy will be the vanguard of our foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 在灵活运用的力量中，外交将是我们外交政策的前卫。

sentences.english: I am willing to be a good housewife even if I always enjoy modern point of view.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我崇尚前卫思想，可我愿意做个好主妇呢。

sentences.english: They wanted to create something at once avant-garde and classical.
sentences.chinese: 他们想立刻制造前卫经典的产品。

sentences.english: Hip, edgy jeans make him think you're too cool for school.
sentences.chinese: 低腰的窄脚牛仔裤会让他觉得你太过前卫。

sentences.english: In my works, I've been trying to realize avant-guard architectural forms.
sentences.chinese: 我后来做作品一直是如何在建筑里搞前卫建筑。

sentences.english: I felt as if I had stepped into an avantgarde theatre production.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉我好像进入了一个前卫戏剧院。

sentences.english: Dark shades bring edginess to summer dressing.
sentences.chinese: 暗色调为夏日衣装带来前卫感。

sentences.english: Part white with aluminium alloy and fuselage Bamboo fibre, simple sense and halfback.
sentences.chinese: 机身部分用铝合金和白色竹纤维构成，超质感和前卫。

sentences.english: A touch of the avant-garde playfulness of Lennon’s early New York period is on display as well.
sentences.chinese: 列侬早期在纽约的前卫玩意也有在展出。

sentences.english: That's where the cutting edge of whatever it is.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，无论什么东西都很前卫。

sentences.english: However, this building, his office, is not his best modern-style architectural work.
sentences.chinese: 而这个建筑，并非是邬达克最前卫的作品。

sentences.english: Brazilian wing-back Cesar admits he wants a return to Lazio.
sentences.chinese: 巴西前卫塞萨尔承认他希望回到拉齐奥。

sentences.english: In that way, patent-licensing is very much pro-innovation.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，版权许可就是一个非常前卫的创新。

sentences.english: Curve cutting of small round neck set the most suitable girl fashion dress.
sentences.chinese: 曲线剪裁的小圆领的套装等最适合少女前卫性穿。

definition: sense of movement (often in a static work of art)/dynamic/vivid/lifelike
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)

to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
conforming with the norms of society
